Key Match Events: Jos Buttler and Alex Hales launched an audacious chase, taking 63 runs from the initial six overs and reaching a century stand from just 10.1 overs.
Hales and Buttler put on the highest-ever partnership in T20 World Cups.
Their feat was also England's highest opening stand in T20 cricket and the nation's second-largest union for any wicket in the shortest format.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler led England brilliantly alongside Alex Hales, who made a quickfire half-century at the top of England's order.
Jos Buttler is speaking and credits England's replacements, particularly Chris Jordan, who came in having not played and bowled brilliantly to take three wickets.
Alex Hales is speaking and says the Adelaide Oval is one of the best grounds to bat at in the world, especially in the power plays, and that tonight is one of the best nights of his career.
Rohit Sharma is speaking and says India just didn't turn up today, with the bowling not good enough over the course of the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Alex Hales blasted 86 not out from 47 balls as England reached 0-170 with 24 balls to spare in Thursday night's semi-final at Adelaide Oval.
India posted 6-168 with Hardik Pandya smacking five sixes and Virat Kohli making his fourth half-century from six knocks in the tournament.
England's stunning 10-wicket win sets up a Sunday night final against Pakistan at the MCG.
